intro: Tetraria variabilis, commonly known as the variable tetraria, is a small, herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or rocky habitats. Due to its adaptability, it is considered a resilient species in its native environment.
